Alexis Giauque
Associate Professor
Ecole Centrale de Lyon

Welcome to my professional homepage!

View on GitHub
  • Research Projects
  • Lectures & Courses
  • Vitae
  • Contact

My research interests include Turbomachinery flows, combustion, acoustics and turbulence modeling using Large Eddy Simulation.

Research Projects

Publications & Conferences

Turbomachinery Flows and Dense Gas Turbulence Modeling

[1] Alexis Giauque, Christophe Corre, and Aur ́elien Vadrot. Direct numer- ical simulations of forced homogeneous isotropic turbulence in a dense gas. Journal of Turbulence, 2020.

[2] Aur ́elien Vadrot, Alexis Giauque, and Christophe Corre. Analysis of turbulence characteristics in a temporal dense gas compressible mixing layer using direct numerical simulation. Journal of Fluid Mechanics, 893(A10), 2020.

[3] J Boudet and Alexis Giauque. Adaptation and evaluation of a weak recycling strategy for inflow boundary layers in large-eddy simulation. Computers & Fluids, page 104489, 2020.

[4] A Vadrot, Alexis Giauque, and C Corre. Investigation of turbulent dense gas flows with direct numerical simulation. 2019.

[5] Alexis Giauque, Christophe Corre, and Aur ́elien Vadrot. Direct numeri- cal simulation of turbulent dense gas flows. In International Seminar on Non-Ideal Compressible-Fluid Dynamics for Propulsion & Power, pages 76–87. Springer, Cham, 2018.

[6] Alexis Giauque, C Corre, and Matteo Menghetti. Direct numerical sim- ulations of homogeneous isotropic turbulence in a dense gas. In J Phys Conf Ser, volume 821, page 012017, 2017.

[7] Alexis Giauque, J ́eroˆme Boudet, Hongwei Ma, and Wei Wei. Large eddy simulation of an axial compressor rotor passage: Preliminary comparison with experimental measurements. In Congr`es fran ̧cais de m ́ecanique. AFM, Association Fran ̧caise de M ́ecanique, 2015.

Combustion and Acoustics Modeling

[8] Ariane Emmanuelli, Jun Zheng, Maxime Huet, Alexis Giauque, Thomas Le Garrec, and S ́ebastien Ducruix. Description and application of a 2d- axisymmetric model for entropy noise in nozzle flows. Journal of Sound and Vibration, 2020.

[9] Jun Zheng, Maxime Huet, Alexis Giauque, Franck Cl ́ero, and S ́ebastien Ducruix. A 2d-axisymmetric analytical model for the estimation of indi- rect combustion noise in nozzle flows. In 21st AIAA/CEAS Aeroacous- tics Conference, page 2974, 2015.

[10] Alexis Giauque, Maxime Huet, Franck Clero, S ́ebastien Ducruix, and Franck Richecoeur. Thermoacoustic shape optimization of a subsonic nozzle. Journal of engineering for gas turbines and power, 135(10), 2013.

[11] Maxime Huet and Alexis Giauque. A nonlinear model for indirect com- bustion noise through a compact nozzle. Journal of Fluid Mechanics, 733:268, 2013.

[12] Michael Brear, Franck Nicoud, Mohsen Talei, Alexis Giauque, and Evatt Hawkes. Disturbance energy transport and sound production in gaseous combustion. 2012.

[13] Alexis Giauque, Maxime Huet, and Franck Clero. Analytical analysis of indirect combustion noise in subcritical nozzles. Journal of Engineering for Gas Turbines and Power, 134(11):111202, 2012.

[14] Alexis Giauque, B Ortun, B Rodriguez, and B Caruelle. Numerical error analysis with application to transonic propeller aeroacoustics. Comput- ers & fluids, 69:20–34, 2012.

[15] Alexis Giauque, Thierry Poinsot, and Franck Nicoud. Validation of a flame transfer function reconstruction method for complex turbulent configurations. In 14th AIAA/CEAS Aeroacoustics Conference (29th AIAA Aeroacoustics Conference), page 2943, 2008.

[16] Alexis Giauque and H Pitsch. Detailed modeling of combustion noise us- ing a hydrodynamic/acoustic splitting model. Center for Turbulence Research, Annual Research Briefs, pages 325–337, 2008.

[17] Mohsen Talei, Michael Brear, Franck Nicoud, Daniel Bodony, and Alexis Giauque. Transport of disturbance energy in hot and cold turbulent jets. In 13th AIAA/CEAS Aeroacoustics Conference (28th AIAA Aeroacous- tics Conference), page 3633, 2007.

[18] AX Sengissen, Alexis Giauque, GS Staffelbach, M Porta, W Krebs, P Kauf- mann, and TJ Poinsot. Large eddy simulation of piloting effects on turbulent swirling flames. Proceedings of the Combustion Institute, 31(2):1729–1736, 2007.

[19] Alexis Giauque, Anne Laure Birbaud, and Heinz Pitsch. Entropy gen- erated noise: a comparison between compressible simulations and gol- stein’s acoustic analogy. APS, 60:GH–005, 2007.

[20] Alexis Giauque, Franck Nicoud, and Michael Brear. Numerical assess- ment of stability criteria from disturbance energies in gaseous combus- tion. In 13th AIAA/CEAS Aeroacoustics Conference (28th AIAA Aeroa- coustics Conference), page 3425, 2007.

[21] Alexis Giauque and H Pitsch. Detailed modeling of combustion noise using a computational aeroacoustics model. Stanford CTR Annual Research Briefs, 2007.

[22] Alexis Giauque. Flame transfer function and disturbance energies in gaseous reacting flows. PhD thesis, 2007.

[23] Alexis Giauque, T Poinsot, M Brear, and F Nicoud. Budget of disturbance energy in gaseous reacting flows. In Proc. of the Summer Program, pages 285–297. Center for Turbulence Research, NASA Ames/Stanford Univ., 2006.

[24] Alexis Giauque, Laurent SELLE, L Gicquel, T Poinsot, H Buechner, P Kauf- mann, and W Krebs. System identification of a large-scale swirled par- tially premixed combustor using les and measurements. Journal of Tur- bulence, (6):N21, 2005.

There’s a horizontal rule below this.

Here is an unordered list:

  • Item foo
  • Item bar
  • Item baz
  • Item zip

And an ordered list:

  1. Item one
  2. Item two
  3. Item three
  4. Item four

And a nested list:

  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
      • level 3 item
      • level 3 item
  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
  • level 1 item
